content.description: Start on the left end of the ledge as for Deviance 5.10 Roof. This route climbs through the first two bolts on the face of Deviance, then shoots off to the left on its own bolt line (five new bolts, then anchors). Traverse off into the sunset to a slabby finish.
content.protection: 8 bolts + anchors (7 bolts if you skip the bolt below the starting ledge) a stickclip is advised for the bolt above the ledge (technically the second bolt)
content.location: Starts in the center of Sunshine Roof, then goes way off to the left.

content.description: The route is pretty dirty with a few over grown plants making it difficult to get over to it on the ledge and making it a little more difficult to climb. The best part of the route is about half way up when you pull yourself around the corner with the potential for an awesome heel hook.
content.location: On the right side of the wall starting in the dihedrial

content.description: The left route on the light colored wall of Sunshine Roof. The opening moves on the dirty slab suck...but get past it on thin moves and the climbing gets fun quick. Make sure you have long draws or runners for bolts 3 and 4 to minimize drag. Big holds over the roof to pull...route is not as intimidating as it looks from below. On a sunny day, this wall gets hot! I see why its called sunshine roof...Wall faces SW and it's concave, it just traps heat! Great winter wall.
content.protection: 5 bolts to anchors. Stick clip is recommended. First bolt is high on ledge, not to mention just high off the ground, possibly 15-20' high off the ground.
content.location: Take main trail from Sex Canyon down towards the river. Continue to spur and stay right as if your going to Dead Cats. Look up and you will see roof to your right.

content.description: Small roof area, orange in color. This area gets lots of sun for most of the day during the summer and winter.
